title: Operations Analyst
description:
As an NRG employee, we encourage you to think creatively and proactively about your career choices. Our work environment is dynamic and the career opportunities across our businesses offer variety and challenge. Providing career growth to our own employees is critical to our ongoing success--take charge of your career goals and empower your future!


Job Summary:


The Operations Analyst will assist the Management team of Operations focusing on product maintenance, contract entry and will also be liaison between Direct Energy and the distributors. This position requires the ability to work in a very fast-paced environment and requires a highly motivated and loyal candidate with solid critical thinking, process management, quantitative, and technical skills.


Essential Duties/Responsibilities:


+ Act as liaison between Direct Energy and Alberta Distributors

+ Manage and maintain the product library for deregulated business.

+ Manage third party vendor to ensure enrollments are processed accurately and timely.

+ Act as subject matter expert for product and sales enrollment questions

+ Thorough understanding of customer lifecycle from contract initiation to fulfillment and final account processing

+ Create detail process documentation when needed for training and resource reference and provide training as needed for internal and interdepartmental personnel.

+ Resolve reported issues in a timely and decisive manner, or escalate as appropriate

+ Demonstrated expertise on data analysis for DE to proactively identify business gaps and/or opportunities, facilitate change and resolve issues.

+ Gathers data/information, completes analysis, and recommends new initiatives or amendments to current operating methods with a focus on 'best in class' operational processes

+ Develop & implement tools and processes to extract and manipulate data from various systems / resources including development of ad-hoc reports in order to solve operational issues and/or improve existing processes

+ Define/write business requirements for changes

+ Works closely with team members to leverage expertise and ensure seamless delivery of initiatives on time and within budget

+ Interact with cross-functional groups including Sales, Marketing, Compliance, and Change Management to ensure smooth and timely execution of business projects.

+ Perform other duties as assigned


Minimum Requirements:


+ Undergraduate degree in business, communications, or related field OR 4+ years experience in an operations related role

+ Strong investigative and problem-solving aptitude.


Preferred Qualifications:


+ 2-3 years of relevant experience in operations management and/or the Utilities/Retail energy industry

+ Business Analyst certificate considered an asset

+ Ability to work independently, comfortably making rational and reasoned decisions which directly impact corporate revenue, customer service and financial liabilities

+ Demonstrated advance technical skills with Microsoft Access, Excel, SQL, Power point and ability to develop Macro or VBA

+ Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

+ Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to multi-task in fast paced environment.

+ Strong interpersonal skills and team player


Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


+ Questions “the way things have always been done” to ensure that processes and results continue to be relevant and add value

+ Ability to excel in a fast past, highly volatile environment; effectively managing multiple activities and meeting deadlines with little supervision.

+ Displays a high level of curiosity and translates it into new approaches to problem identification and solution


Working Conditions:


+ Open office environment, in office full-time.

+ Some overtime required as special projects arise _._


Physical Requirements:


+ Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about


NRG Energy is committed to providing broad access to employment opportunities so that diverse job seekers can apply to positions, and to ensuring our workforce represents the diverse communities we serve. We abide by human rights legislation and accommodate applicants and employees in accordance with applicable law.


Any information you provide through this form will be used and disclosed for the purposes of considering your application and, if you are offered a job, in relation to your employment (including post employment activities). If you have provided references, you consent to us contacting such references and obtaining your personal information from them. Do not submit references if you have not obtained the consent of such references. Your personal information will otherwise be handled in accordance with our privacy policy.

title: Operations Data Analyst
description:
As a Data Analyst on the Operations Team, you will play a vital role in the development of current and future reporting and trends analysis for all of operations.  Your number one focus as a Data Analyst with the operations team will be to ensure that the departments have the data necessary to run and improve their business.  This includes regular reporting and various projects that will support all areas of operations.   

 

As part of the Data Analyst role, you are responsible for creating reporting that is automated, validating data sources, enhancing data needed by departments, and working to streamline the data sources from various technology platforms.  This role works very closely with system integration projects to ensure that the proper data is not corrupted and is ultimately enhanced through technology changes in the departments.   

 

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

 

  • Gather requirements from subject matter experts to create reports needed for all Operations departments
  • Work with department leaders to identify opportunities for improvement
  • Create and maintain regular reporting, weekly, monthly and quarterly for business needs
  • Organize and provide data in formats that are usable for teams and leaders to effect change and improve their business
  • Interface directly with internal department leaders to provide exceptional communication and support
  • Assist with identifying and solving data gaps and inaccuracies
  • Continuous improvement on reporting tools to evolve into automation and leader direct access to reporting when necessary
  • Regular involvement in system integration planning and logistics to provide input for data and reporting needs
  • Work with leaders to clearly define KPIs and ensure that reporting is properly correlated to established goals

QUALIFICATIONS:

 

EDUCATION:

 

  • College degree preferred; equivalent experience may be accepted

 

EXPERIENCE:

 

  • 3-5 years’ as a Data Analyst or related field preferred (QA/QC/BA)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills
  • Positive attitude and solutions oriented thinking
  • Must be able to produce high-quality work as part of a fast-paced, dynamic team
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; excellent follow up skills required
  • Experience with accounting systems or financial reporting is highly desirable
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities with minimal supervision
  • Proficient knowledge of Microsoft office including Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Tableau proficiency strongly desired
  • Knowledge of SalesForce preferred
  • Knowledge of JIRA Preferred
  • Strong team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Experience collaborating with remote teams preferred
  • Experience within real estate or real estate brokerages preferred
  • Occasional travel may be required (US and Canada)

 

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES:

 

  • The ability to organize, set and implement priorities and manage multiple tasks.
  • Success with the ability to show flexibility, sound business judgment and highly developed personal, analytical, and communication skills

title: Lead Data Scientist
description:
Company Description

At IFS you will work in a growing, global enterprise software company built upon committed and empowered colleagues who come to work knowing they are making a difference. We work every day within our single platform and embedded digital innovation to help our customers be their best when it really matters to their customers – at the Moment of Service™. We take pride in ensuring that our employees are able to achieve the company goals as well as develop their career. We believe empowered autonomy, committed colleagues and being part of a winning team are the keys to our success and what makes us great!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Job Description

We are looking for a Lead Data Scientist to be part of our global R&D organization. Someone who brings a positive energy to the team, thrives on strong collaboration, and who strives for constant improvement in both themselves and the team. Someone who will be a key player within our Automation team and will help us transform our Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning vision into a reality.

As a technical expert within the Automation team, you will be bringing AI and ML capabilities to the next generation IFS Cloud for Enterprise Resource Planning, Asset Management and Field Service Management. You will be working on applied mission critical problems ranging from IIoT/predictive maintenance, demand planning/forecasting, optimization, and autonomous intelligent assistants. Your expertise as a data scientist will help us design and automate complex ML pipelines, enhance our algorithmic pool, and drive innovation across our product portfolio.

Your critical thinking skills and understanding of real-world business problems will be key to contributing to the end-to-end design of the solutions: from seeing the big picture and identifying the opportunity to implementation and delivery with an emphasis on performance and scalability.

If you excel at mapping/understanding business processes and the underlaying data, passionate about machine learning and statistics and take pride in building and integrating high-performance ML pipelines in a production setting, we would love to hear from you.

Responsibilities

This is a highly technical/hands-on senior position where you will be expected to carry out the following tasks with a high degree of autonomy, accountability, and technical proficiency:

-  Help identify high value/high impact AI/ML opportunities within the IFS product offerings.

-  Act as AI/ML technical expert to evaluate/recommend the adoption of new/emerging technologies. Provide advice on estimates and implementation plans to support planning and roadmap activities.

-  Work with product and program management to ensure that complex solutions can be broken into incremental steps to ensure continuous value delivery.

-  Lead technical solution design and integration tasks for data science projects: from proof of concepts to final implementation/deployment and monitoring with a focus on scalability and performance.

-  Work in close collaboration with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Software Engineers, Solution Architects and Product/Program Managers on the definition, creation, and deployment, monitoring and documentation of bespoke and industry-wide ML models.

-  Act as an AI/ML evangelist for the team:  participating in conferences, webinars, writing white papers/blogs. Sharing data exploration findings and model outputs in a domain/business context to clients and internal stakeholders and provide actionable recommendations.

Qualifications

-    5  years of experience in data science roles solving business critical problems, backed by a history of successfully completed projects.

-   Proven track record of leading and building end-to-end implementation of AI/ML solutions(e.g., scoping, design, development, testing, deployment, and monitoring).

-   Experience building and delivering Cloud ML solutions at scale using Docker/Kubernetes. 

-   Proven knowledge of advanced statistical modelling and analysis.

-   Expert knowledge of ML development tools/libraries in Python. Ability to deep dive into the code and mentor others on best practices.

-  Excellent communication skills, with the ability to couple subject matter expertise with strong statistical skills.

-  Result-driven individual, passionate and self-starter, proactive requiring minimal supervision, highly organized, have an ability to handle multiple tasks, creative and strategic thinker.

Nice to have

-    Experience with ML experiment tracking and collaboration tools (e.g., Mlflow, Weights & Biases, etc.)

-   Experience with pipeline orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Kubeflow/Argo, etc.)

-   Expertise in Conversational AI, NLP, Transfer Learning/deep learning.

-   Intelligent assistants, knowledge base/graphs and recommender systems.

 



Additional Information

Interviews and selections are being made continuously. If you are interested, apply as soon as possible.
 

IFS fact

IFS develops and delivers enterprise software for customers around the world who manufacture and distribute goods, build and maintain assets, and manage service-focused operations. The industry expertise of our people and solutions, together with a commitment to delivering value to every one of our customers, has made IFS a recognized leader and the most recommended supplier in our sector. Our team of 4,000 employees and growing ecosystem of partners support more than 10,000 customers around the world challenge the status quo and realize their competitive advantage. Learn more about how our enterprise software solutions can help your business today at ifs.com.

title: Process and Procedure Analyst
description:
Are you a talented Analyst, keen to deliver solutions designed to improve customer value? Our Winnipeg, Manitoba client is seeking to hire an Analyst to join their team on a long-term contract with high potential for extension. Apply to this amazing Analyst opportunity today!

What’s in it for you!
As an Analyst with our Winnipeg client, you’ll receive
• Competitive market hourly rates.
• A 7-month contract with a high potential for extension.
• Remote interview process.
• Opportunity to work from home during Covid-19.

What will you do?
As a Analyst with our Winnipeg client, you will:
• Manage and maintain all ITSM processes and procedures through a centralized and auditable manner
• Build and conduct regular communication/socialization/training sessions on processes.
• Understanding of ServiceNow modules
• Write, format, edit, review, and proof procedural and technical information for technical and nontechnical users
• Collaborate with software developers and Process Analysts, stakeholders and specialists .

How do you qualify?
To qualify for the Systems Analyst with our Winnipeg client, you must have:
• Experience in IT Service Management projects.
• Expereince with ITIL methodologies, IT architecture, JavaScript, web software design principals, database architecture, and relational databases.
• Ability to transform highly technical documents into clear, concise written material for a variety of audiences
• Proven experience in institutionalizing target state processes within organizations

If the prospect of building a career in the technical and business domains by providing support while honing your analysis skills intrigues you, then the Analyst role with our Winnipeg, Manitoba client could be the perfect opportunity for you!

Please contact Shawn Siepman at shawn.siepman@randstad.ca for more information, or click the Apply button now!

Advantages
What’s in it for you!
As an Analyst with our Winnipeg client, you’ll receive
• Competitive market hourly rates.
• A 7-month contract with a high potential for extension.
• Remote interview process.
• Opportunity to work from home during Covid-19.

Responsibilities
What will you do?
As a Analyst with our Winnipeg client, you will:
• Manage and maintain all ITSM processes and procedures through a centralized and auditable manner
• Build and conduct regular communication/socialization/training sessions on processes.
• Understanding of ServiceNow modules
• Write, format, edit, review, and proof procedural and technical information for technical and nontechnical users
• Collaborate with software developers and Process Analysts, stakeholders and specialists .

Qualifications
How do you qualify?
To qualify for the Systems Analyst with our Winnipeg client, you must have:
• Experience in IT Service Management projects.
• Expereince with ITIL methodologies, IT architecture, JavaScript, web software design principals, database architecture, and relational databases.
• Ability to transform highly technical documents into clear, concise written material for a variety of audiences
• Proven experience in institutionalizing target state processes within organizations

Summary
If the prospect of building a career in the technical and business domains by providing support while honing your analysis skills intrigues you, then the Analyst role with our Winnipeg, Manitoba client could be the perfect opportunity for you!

Please contact Shawn Siepman at shawn.siepman@randstad.ca for more information, or click the Apply button now!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Analyst, Logistics Operations (16344)
description:
We at Resolute are a diverse group of individuals who possess a wide variety of skills. Here, we believe that giving you the ability to maximize your potential without constraint is key to our shared success.

Our MONTREAL location in Quebec, Canada is currently seeking talent to fill the position of Analyst, Logistics Operations.This job is permanent, full-time.

.

Your challenges:

Reporting to the Supervisor, Logistics Analysis, the Analyst, Logistics will have the overall responsibility for providing required data, information, reports and KPI’s for the corporate Logistics team, relating to all logistics activities for paper, pulp and forest products in both domestic and international markets. 

 

More specifically, you will focus on the following areas:

•    Extract required data from the Corporation’s legacy systems and, in conjunction with the implementation plan, incorporate data extraction using SAP Business Warehouse;
•    Perform weekly and monthly monitoring and maintenance on the corporate demand planning system for the pulp and paper forecasts;
•    Develop and facilitate logistics information needs through SAP Business Warehouse through project roll out;
•    Develop processes to make the required data available for use on an ongoing basis for the Logistics and Planning team; 
•    Provide customized logistics reports and analysis for the managers, as required;
•    Participate in contract negotiations and in logistics operation projects;
•    Maintain necessary data inputs, collect appropriate information, and provide analytical input for the weekly S&OP report for Planning and the monthly Senior Management Report on Logistics.

 

Your profile:
•    Bachelor's Degree in IT or appropriate certification in IT within a large manufacturing environment and/or equivalent business experience;
•    Minimum 1-3 years Logistics experience within a large scales manufacturing environment in a similar role;
•    Demonstrated ability to successfully design processes and provide analysis for a large Logistics Team;  
•    Excellent knowledge of ERP/MRP applications software especially inventory management and production planning;
•    Very good working knowledge of MS Office (Power User);
•    Use and/or exposure to SAP (asset);
•    Strong communication skills in English and French (verbal and written) and presentation competencies.

 

Your skills:
•    Ability to work autonomously, to manage and prioritize multiple projects;
•    Strong organization and analytical skills;
•    Customer oriented;
•    Problem solving;
•    Decision making;
•    Results oriented;
•    Team work.
 

 

Forest products are essential, as are each and every one of our employees and contractors. We take the necessary steps to protect the health and well-being of our employees and to safeguard the integrity of all Resolute facilities.

 

We are all in this together. We are one community. We are #RESOLUTEPROUD

 

Be part of the change. Be part of a dynamic team.
We are a global leader in the forest products industry offering an energetic and safe work environment with opportunities and challenges that will help develop your skills. We are more than 8,000 employees in Canada, the United States and various other international locations.

We are looking for employees with the experience and expertise to improve our efficiency, increase our long-term profitability and deliver first-class products and services to our customers. And you, what are you looking for?

We are a company writing a new story for itself in a rapidly changing industry. We have made important inroads to ensure our viability and to be an environmental supplier of choice. Come take part of our history and be part of the change!

How are we building the Resolute of the future?
Find out in our Annual Report, available at resolutefp.com/publications.

Join the conversation!
Visit The Resolute Blog at blog.resolutefp.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, and YouTube.

title: Staff Data Scientist
description:
Staff Data Scientist

Must Have:

  • 7+ years of experience with general purpose programming languages e.g., Python, C/C++, Java
  • 7+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning and deep learning
Nice to Have:

  • Exposure to machine learning platforms such as TensorFlow, TensorFlow Extended, PyTorch
  • Good to have experience building and deploying machine learning models on the Cloud (Google Cloud, Azure, AWS)
  • Good to have experience with production architecture of machine learning systems
Our client is…

  • A global full-service digital consultancy firm. Their global team is dedicated to delivering seamlessly integrated strategies, immersive user experiences, cross-platform development, deployment, training, and ongoing support. They have a results-focused approach which allows them to understand the client needs, shape digital strategies, and forge a path to deliver business success.
Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with the Engineering and Product teams to build machine learning models into the products and offerings of [24]7.ai, primarily in the space of ad optimization and personalization
  • Lead a small team of data scientists. Be responsible for implementing the machine learning models, testing them, refining them, and taking them to production for our ad optimization and personalization product/offering.
  • Collaborate with other teams in the Data Science Group to review and refine your work to ensure the highest quality
  • Collaborate with the product owners and the data science leadership to chart the AI vision for ad optimization and personalization.

title: Salesforce Operations Analyst - Senior
description:

Duration:2 Years

Requirement:
 

·         Salesforce Administration

·         Provide operational support through the customization and configuration of the Salesforce platform

·         Provide day-to-day user support and will also participate in the strategic enhancements to the platform

·         Manage Salesforce security including roles, profiles, sharing rules, workflows, and groups.

·         Manage operational requests and reporting including customer analysis and individual views and troubleshoot issues.

·         Salesforce certification required

Regards,
Priyanka Chhabria

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Senior Data Scientist

We are worldwide Augmented Hospitality leaders, the best at what we do. Heartists is what we call ourselves, generous, passionate, attentive and free, whether we are welcoming guests, connecting with our peers or serving others.

Our entire Accor estate expands across the world. With over 300,000 experts committed to rejuvenating the hospitality experience we pride ourselves in being the employer of choice, so live limitlessly, come as you are, grow with us, work with purpose and explore the endless opportunities in store.

With summer soon to be upon us, we have a great opportunity to help add some sunshine to your next career move!

Join us in our newly created Data Science Team as Senior Data Scientist where you will work across the business to design and deliver data science solutions to the business.

Here is a snapshot at some of the additional responsibilities you will hold:

  • Work with the business stakeholders to identify opportunities, gather technical requirements and deliver data science projects in the areas of Pricing, Revenue Management, CRM and Marketing. 

  • Involvement in the whole lifecycle of Data Science projects from idea generation, data collection, prototyping and coding through to testing, launch and maintenance

  • Thought leadership and innovation in introducing new tools, standards and methods to Accor data and analytics community. Be up to date with new developments in Data Science.

  • Use data analytics to provide data-driven insights to inform the organizations decisions. Leverage data to influence decision making process

Your profile? A degree level qualification in Computer Science/ statistics and/or numerical with at least 3 year’s experience in applying data science models to real world commercial challenges.

To acknowledge your hard work, loyalty and commitment to us, we offer an extensive benefits package; competitive salary, bonus, season ticket loans, subsidised gym membership, private medical healthcare, pension, and of course complimentary hotel stays (to name a few). 

Your Accor experience begins now, so if you are data driven, curious and you really want to help drive the success of this newly created team then we want to hear from you!

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the Company

At Slate Technologies we are bringing fresh minds and tools to the world of Smart Buildings, Smart Infrastructure, Sustainability, architecture, and construction. With a credible team from world renowned institutions, we are leading the way in transforming the way buildings and Infrastructure comes to life. 

Better decisions happen in construction when you have better context, without context stakeholders are unable to see the right information, at the right time to make confident and quick choices. That's why we created Slate, a Virtual Digital Assistant that helps you identify and evaluate information in your business so that you can make better decisions, save time and money and improve project outcomes.  

Our mission at Slate is to help improve each construction professional impact construction productivity by revealing the timely context that helps them make earlier, better decisions. Slateâ€™s â€œDigital Assistant'' uses machine learning and AI to execute multi-dimensional analysis across internal and external data sources. This includes public data such as weather, labor and traffic with the dark data locked in silos and non-integrated systems within their own and sub-contractor organizations. 

Want to join us on this incredible journey?

What You Will Be Doing

Exciting career opportunity in a Worldwide Engineering Organization, in designing and implementing a new generation of products and solutions that are transformational in nature.  In this position, you will play a key role in designing and building a state-of-the-art AI system to modernize the Smart Buildings and Infrastructure space.Unique opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds in this space and create AI solutions from ground up.

Location: Toronto, Ontario

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

In this job, you will have a unique opportunity to use your machine learning and data engineering skills to â€œAI enableâ€ the smart construction industry.

  • Analyze product requirements and come up with data science solutions.
  • Train machine learning models (NLP or Vision) to meet business requirements.
  • Develop training and inference pipelines which would include data engineering
  • Write production quality python code for model development and as well as for inference.
  • Ability to think out-of-the-box and systemically apply methods to increase accuracy of AI solutions.
  • Take complete ownership of the solution in all phases - proof of concept, data engineering, model development, model tuning, and model implementation.

Required Experience/Skills

  • Masters or bachelor's degree in computer science or related disciplines.
  • 3 years of experience in data science or equivalent.
  • Should have implemented at least 3 machine learning solutions in production.
  • Strong Python skills with focus in data engineering and data analysis.
  • Proficiency with using data mining packages such as Scikit-Learn, NumPy, and Pandas.
  • Strong understanding of machine learning models, model training, and hyper parameter tuning.
  • Working knowledge of deep learning models, loss functions, and accuracy measures.
  • Hands-on proficiency with one of the frameworks - PyTorch/TensorFlow/Keras.
  • Comfortable in using SQL.
  • Experience in NLP solutions preferred.
  • Good conceptual understanding of statistical regression, neural nets, deep learning, decision trees, and ensembles is expected.
  • Self-motivated, enthusiasm to build next generation AI system.

If this sounds like you, you should apply right away so we can discuss how you can be a part of this exciting, fast-paced organization!

Slate Technologies, Inc is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Powered by JazzHR

title: Data Strategist – Firebase
description:
Story Behind the Need:

• Business group: Global Data & Analytics Solutions
• Project: Join the fast based team environment at client as a Data Strategist. The incumbent is a tagging, data analytics and insight specialist supporting digital marketing and banking initiatives across multiple channels and platforms to help drive engagement, leads, sales and loyalty. The contractor will be working with other developers on other project to understand and validate code (providing suggestions to developers on improvements and technically knowledgeable to review written code).
• Reason for request: Backfill

Candidate Value Proposition:

• The successful candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate with internal stakeholders as well as IT to help optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of digital marketing campaigns and tagging strategy.

Job Responsibilities:

• Analyze highly complex business requirements; generate technical specifications to design or redesign complex software components and applications
• Act as an expert technical resource for modeling, simulation and analysis efforts
• Leverage industry best practices to design, test, implement and support a solution
• Assure quality security and compliance requirements are met for supported area
• Be flexible and thrive in an evolving environment
• Adapt to change quickly and adjust work accordingly in a positive manner

Key Accountabilities:

• Determine the design and implementation of digital analytics tracking, tagging, and targeting and provide teams with code for implementation
• Manage a variety of analytics (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics) and tag management (Adobe Launch, Google Tag Manager) accounts across multiple geographies
• Collaborate with frontend developers, backend developers, and analytic teams to build solutions for measurement of client platforms
• Support campaign requirements for pixel and conversion tracking and maintain any link tracking documents
• Create dashboards using Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics
• Assist in the development and documentation of best practices for improving operational efficiencies within the digital analytics team
• Proactively initiate, research, and perform data analysis and provide ad hoc reports to internal stakeholders on web usage, user engagement, and behavioral analytics on websites and email campaigns
• Identify patterns and trends in marketing results and online activity and report on findings
• Analyze digital marketing data and user behavior patterns to provide valuable insight and to optimize user engagement and improve the effectiveness of marketing campaigns
• Monitor site and campaign traffic and determine cross-promotion, cross-sell and lead-gen opportunities
• Familiarity with tag audit tools like ObservePoint and Tag Inspector
• Identify bugs and erroneous analytics tags and provide solutions to development team
• Work with Digital Channels to advise on our continually evolving digital strategy
• Ability to provide clear and concise technical direction, expertise, advice and tracking solutions to frontend developers, backend developers, and analytic teams to build tools for measurement of client platforms

Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:

• 2+ years’ strong understanding of all of the following: HTML, CSS and JavaScript
• 2 + years: Expertise in Adobe Analytics implementation using Adobe Launch
• 2 + years: in configuring web and mobile analytics for multiple clients
• Experience in Microsoft Excel
• Experience with visualization techniques for data analysis and presentation
• Expertise in creating dashboards in Adobe & Google Analytics and transforming data from multiple sources
• Experience presenting reports and strategic recommendations to clients

Nice-To-Have Skills:

• Expertise in Google Analytics implementation using Google Tag Manager
• Expertise in implementing Firebase and Adobe Mobile SDK
• Working knowledge of Power BI and Google Data Studio
• Experience working with digital advertising platforms (Facebook Business Manager, Google Ads, DoubleClick Manager, AppNexus) and search engine optimization is an asset
• Experience with Adobe Experience Manager an asset

Soft Skills:

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously
• Proven ability to work independently and with other groups in a professional and productive manner
• Demonstrated ability to work within extremely tight deadlines
• Excellent analytical, logical, and organizational skills

Best vs Average:

• Experience in Adobe analytics in a tagging perspective and meets all must have criteria. The type of candidate would likely be a previous developer who moved into a more web analytics space (title of role in official channel is Data Strategist).
• The candidate must have Adobe Analytics for this role, with Google Analytics being a great asset. A candidate with GA but not Adobe analytics will not be considered.

Degrees or certifications:

• Bachelor’s degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required

Candidate Review & Selection:

• Structure and Format: Two rounds (+ potential third round):
o Screening interview with HM
o Technical interview with subject matter experts + HM
o Potential meeting with VP or director if indicated

title: Lead, Data Science
description:
AMA:

LEADERSHIP YOU CAN

data BANK ON

 

Posted: 2022-04-07

Closing: When Filled
Location: Edmonton South

 

Join our Data & Analytics team to lead ensuring that the Association is using machine learning and advanced analytics responsibly to deliver the highest level of service to staff and members.    You have responsibility for the research, development, interpretation, and deployment of machine learning and predictive models in support of understanding and predicting member behaviour to organizational drive decision making.

 

WHAT MOVES YOU

  • Youâ€™re a natural mentor and supportive coach who enjoys collaborating with other people. Bringing out the best in others, brings out the best in you.
  • You love collaborating and are always first to put up your hand to help the team. Superstar!
  • Youâ€™re a master problem-solver with a knack for analyzing risks and identifying the best solutions.
  • You manage your time as expertly as you manage your projects. Itâ€™s just part of your DNA.
  • Developing productive and collaborative working relationships comes as naturally to you as breathing!
  • Youâ€™re a confident speaker whoâ€™s as comfortable presenting data as mining it.

 

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Report to the Senior Manager, Data.
  • You'll strive to develop and maintain a sound understanding of business processes across the Association to help with your data science efforts.
  • Build and deploy robust machine learning models which are grounded in solving specific business problems.
  • Build state-of-the-art machine learning best practices, including model selection, training, evaluation, pipelines, storage, deployment and ongoing governance.
  • Youâ€™ll be responsible for leadership of our co-op students as part of our strategy to recruit and retain talent via an ongoing data science pipeline and funnel.
  • Youâ€™ll provide adequate training for your team, fully understanding business priorities and link those priorities to a proper data and machine learning strategy.
  • Youâ€™ll strive to develop and maintain a sound understanding of business processes across the association to help facilitate:
    • Consistent business logic and confident business partnerships,
    • Minimal errors in interpretation of requirements and execution of analyses,
    • Consulting with business areas to deliver analytic value on an operational and ad hoc basis.

 

WHAT YOU'VE DONE

  • You have an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics or another quantitative field.
  • You have at least seven (7) yearsâ€™ experience in data science, machine learning, predictive modeling, deep learning and/or natural language processing.
  • You are proficient in best practice machine learning model development and deployment methods.
  • You are proficient in AWS architecture, including SageMaker, for machine learning model development, deployment, MLOps, CI/CD.
  • You have strong and proven leadership skills.
  • You have strong problem-solving and organizational skills.
  • You are proficient with statistical programming languages (R, Python) and relational databases/SQL.
  • You have strong experience in Containers and Kubernetes.
  • You have experience in AWS Personalize.
  • Ideally, you have experience with distributed computing frameworks (Spark, Hadoop, etc).

 

WHAT YOU'LL GET

  • Competitive salary.
  • Flexible benefits.
  • Outstanding employer-paid Defined Pension Plan.
  • Great AMA discounts.
  • Unlimited learning opportunities.
  • Paid vacation and floater day.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest;  however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Please note: all offers are subject to the completion of satisfactory references and various security checks (including a Police Information Check) where applicable.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Our mission is to Profoundly change the standard of care by creating a tomorrow where clinicians can confidently ablate tissue with precision; a tomorrow where patients have access to safe and effective treatment options, so they can quickly return to their daily lives. Changing the standard of care is part of our fabric. We are a group of energetic, problem-solvers focused on innovation, and looking to change the world. We are changing the paradigm for treating diseases such as prostate cancer by using real-time MR Imaging, thermal ultrasound and close-loop temperature feedback control, to gently ablate the diseased tissue with minimal side effects.

If you share our values and want to work in a collaborative results focused culture and want to make a Profound impact in healthcare and your career, here is your chance.

General Accountability

The Data Scientist researches, develops, improves, and evaluates the core technologies and features used in Profound Medicalâ€™s products through simulations and machine learning.
The Data Scientist is primarily responsible for:

  • Researching and executing simulations related to ultrasound propagation and heating in tissues, and magnetic resonance thermometry which are the technologies at the core of the Companyâ€™s product.
  • Developing and improving Profoundâ€™s products using machine learning and deep learning methods, leveraging treatment and imaging data.

He or she also stays abreast of the state of the art in these fields, researches what competitors are developing, and participates in the growth of the intellectual property portfolio. He or she works as a liaison with external research partners.

Duties and Responsibilities

Primary duties are as follows:

  • Invent, develop, improve, analyze and validate treatment algorithms at the core of the companyâ€™s product, with the aim to maximize speed and efficiency while maintaining safety;
  • Develop and execute ultrasound and MR simulations under various mechanical and physiological conditions to assist in the design of ultrasound transducers, or clinical workflows.
  • Evaluate and research improvements to Profound Medicalâ€™s core technologies (real-time MR thermometry, high-intensity therapeutic ultrasound) and identify its strengths and weaknesses against its competitorsâ€™ technology;
  • Develop, train, and evaluate computer vision models to improve treatment performance and safety using machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques.
  • Develop and implement data analytics tools to assess treatment and test outcomes, predict technical failures, or track sites performance.
  • Establish a liaison with external research partners, contribute to their research as needed, and transfer knowledge back to Profound Medical.

Additional duties may be required at times, such as:

  • Contribute to real-time thermometry image processing algorithms
  • Develop, test and optimize MRI protocols for various MRI models; and
  • Contribute to system or software validation protocols and to their execution
  • Investigate product complaints, perform root cause analysis of failures, and propose remediation in a timely fashion
  • Generate Intellectual Property by analyzing, inventing and documenting designs and methods
  • Interact with the wider scientific community through publications and attending conferences
  • Participate in the generation of system requirements and specifications
  • Participate in risk management and usability engineering activities
  • Assist Company in planning, development, and execution of clinical trials.
  • Assist in the regulatory submissions of products; participate in regulatory strategy discussions; liaise with physicians on future clinical investigations initiated by the company and external parties

Education/Certification

  • Masters or PhD in Biomedical Engineering, Medical Physics or equivalent

Key Attributes (experience, skills and technical knowledge)

Required:
Excellent communication skills in English, verbal and written
3 years of experience with medical technology, preferably MR or ultrasound
3 years research experience (experimental design, writing articles, presenting at conferences)
Experience with numerical simulations of physical processes such as wave propagation and thermal diffusion
Ability to thoroughly document and summarize all aspects of development and testing efforts
Matlab and/or Python
A portfolio of scientific publications (journal articles and conferences) and demonstrated ability to relate to researchers
Valid passport for travel to Canada, United States and Europe

Desirable:

  • Software development using C# or/and C
  • Knowledge of high-intensity therapeutic ultrasound is an asset
  • Experience of medical image processing and algorithms such as segmentation and registration
  • Experience with building and training ML / AI models

We thank you for your interest in Profound Medical. Please note only candidates that are short-listed will be contacted.

We strive to promote diversity and equal opportunity in the workplace and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require.

#LI-DNI

title: Data Scientist
description:
Join our Winning Team as a Data Scientist

When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. And just announced, the return of the 4-day work week from May 30th through Labour Day! We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” isn’t just a catchy saying, it’s part of the #CARFAXdifference! 

As a Data Scientist, you will be working with the Data Services and Data Technologies teams to create machine learning solutions for a new product. You will work collaboratively with data engineers and data mappers to design, build and scale our ambitious machine learning and natural language processing solutions.

As a Data Scientist, your responsibilities will include:

  • Leading the design, development and deployment of our deep learning, ML and NLP solutions
  • Maintaining and improving established, advanced machine learning processes on data mining
  • Providing actionable ad hoc analytics insights for internal stakeholders
  • Designing and building recurring reports for internal stakeholders to make data-driven decisions
  • Using advanced analytical methods to explore and extract additional data value for existing and emerging products
  • Documenting analysis results and presenting value to stakeholders
  • Creating reusable processes to assist data evaluation and analysis across teams within the Data Services department

To be considered for this role, you will need:

  • Master’s Degree in Statistics, Data Science or related field
  • 4+ years’ experience in SQL/Spark, R, Python
  • 4+ years of experience in building and applying machine learning, predictive modeling, or natural language processing solutions to business problems
  • Deep understanding and experience with advanced statistics and modern machine learning predictive techniques, including GLMs, decision trees, boosted ensembles, neural networks, deep learning, etc.
  • Experience with Named Entity Recognition (NER), Sentiment Analysis, Data Tokenization, Lexical Semantics, Relationship Extraction, etc.
  • Ability to effectively communicate analysis and insights to all levels of the organization
  • A passion for continuous learning
  • Confidence to challenge the status quo

title: Entwicklungsingenieur ADAS (w/m/d)
description:
Jobnummer:42561 
Gruppe: Magna Steyr 
Division: EC Germany Telemotive 
Art der Beschäftigung: Festanstellung 
Standort: WOLFSBURG
 

 

 

Gruppenbeschreibung

 

Magna Telemotive ist ein führender strategischer Entwicklungspartner international agier­ender Unternehmen im Automotive-Umfeld. Das Unternehmen entwickelt vernetzte und nachhaltige Mobilitätskonzepte.

Die Kernkompetenzen sind Softwareentwicklung, HMI (Human-Machine-Interface), Infotainment, Connectivity sowie au­tomobilspezifische Tools und Digitalisierung. Das Unternehmen ist Teil von Magna Steyr, einem der weltweit führenden, markenunabhängigen Engineering- und Fertigungspartner für Automobilhersteller.

Der Wandel der Automobilindustrie hat bereits begonnen und eine Vielzahl an Elektrofahrzeugen ist bereits erhältlich auf dem Markt. Aufgrund der neuen Begebenheiten und innovativen Möglichkeiten im Bereich der Elektromobilität stehen wir vor neuen Herausforderungen. Eine erfolgreiche Mobilitätswende kann nur Hand in Hand mit einer Energiewende funktionieren. Mit deiner Unterstützung stellen wir sicher, dass die Netzintegration der Elektrofahrzeuge gelingt und leisten einen wichtigen Beitrag im Bereich der Sektor Kopplung.

Werde jetzt Teil der Mobilitätslösung von Morgen.

Das ist die passende Stelle für dich:

  • Technischer Ansprechpartner (beim Kunden)
  • Entgegennahme und Analyse von Defects am betreuten Steuergerät
  • Herbeiführung von Maßnahmen zur technischen Lösung
  • Implementierung von SW- und HW-Updates auf Kundenseite
  • Nachverfolgung von Fehlerabstellprozessen
  • Nachprüfung der Lösungsintegration

Wir suchen jemanden wie dich:

  • Kenntnisse über das organisatorische Entwicklungsnetzwerk bei VW
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Toollandschaft VW
  • Erfahrung Steuergeräteentwicklung
  • Erfahrung im Bereich ADAS
  • Erfahrung mit den Praktiken im Bereich Flashen, Codieren und Analysieren
  • Basiswissen Kamerakalibrierung
  • Fähigkeit zur Koordination in einem vielschichtigen Projektumfeld

Freu dich auf:

 

Während unseres On-Boarding-Programms lernst du in den ersten Tagen die offene Magna Telemotive Kultur mit seinen flachen Hierarchien kennen. Ein Pate steht dir zudem die ersten 6 Monate mit Rat und Tat zur Seite. Zudem können wir flexible Arbeitszeiten ohne Kernarbeitszeiten, 30 Tage Urlaub sowie eine Gewinnbeteiligung bieten. Kostenloser Tee und Kaffee sind für uns ebenfalls selbstverständlich. Die Magna Telemotive verbindet damit die Stärken eines Großkonzerns mit der Flexibilität eines mittelständischen Betriebes.


Wir freuen uns auf deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung mit Gehaltsangabe sowie Starttermin.

Schwerbehinderte Bewerberinnen und Bewerber werden bei gleicher Eignung besonders berücksichtigt.

08--Engineering F--Permanent/Regular

title: Data Process Analyst
description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

This job description does not represent a comprehensive listing of job duties that are required of the employee performing this role. We reserve the right to change duties or assign additional duties at any time with or without notice.

People Leader Role: No

Key Accountabilities:

Individual Accountabilities:

• Responsible for executing technical and business projects across multiple stakeholders; developing analysis to support process and project improvements

• Researches and analyzes improvement opportunities, conducts analysis, prepares recommendations and facilitates efficiency enhancements

• Develops business requirement documents and specifications

• Works as directed by management team to research and document business issues involving workflow procedures and processes

• Analyzes data and work with management to develop creative solutions

• Proactively identifies issues with workflows and processes; suggests improvements to management

• Reviews suggested workplans

• Coordinates ongoing service, maintenance post-implementation

• Manages teams

• Has positive impact to specific organizational entities & has some understanding of the nature of the impact

• Usually a top contributor to team's success

Key Shared Accountabilities:

• Job Requirements:

• Demonstrates understanding of how technology supports Manulife's strategy

• Strong detail orientation

• Awareness of full-technology stack

• Strong communicator who can negotiate effectively with business to clarify needs vs. wants/likes in order to balance business direction/requirements with cost of development and risk

• An effective facilitator for the Team to deliver incremental and iterative units of business value

• Has a natural ability to breakdown, decompose and describe business needs into Stories supporting an iterative and incremental delivery model

• Mentors Associate Business Analysts

• Seeks coaching from experts

• Attends advanced training on analysis skills and business knowledge

• Demonstrates all core skills, and good interpersonal skills for the role

• Good working / background knowledge of practice area

• Use and combine knowledge of the discipline and the market to formulate the right approach

• Fit for purpose, though may lack refinement

• Sees actions partly in terms of longer-term goals

• Understands the corporate climate & culture

• Strong knowledge of the business

• Constantly learns from both success and failure

• Good organizational and problem-solving abilities that enable you to manage through creative abrasion

• Good verbal and written communication; able to effectively articulate technical vision, possibilities, and outcomes

Decision Authorities:

• Able to achieve most tasks using own judgement

• Can lead smaller groups where required

• Good analytical skills, copes with complex situations through deliberate analysis and planning

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock and Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact

recruitment@manulife.com

.

• Responsible for executing technical and business projects across multiple stakeholders; developing analysis to support process and project improvements

• Researches and analyzes improvement opportunities, conducts analysis, prepares recommendations and facilitates efficiency enhancements

• Develops business requirement documents and specifications

• Works as directed by management team to research and document business issues involving workflow procedures and processes

• Analyzes data and work with management to develop creative solutions

• Proactively identifies issues with workflows and processes; suggests improvements to management

• Reviews suggested workplans

• Coordinates ongoing service, maintenance post-implementation

• Manages teams

• Has positive impact to specific organizational entities & has some understanding of the nature of the impact

• Usually a top contributor to team's success

Key Shared Accountabilities:

• Job Requirements:

• Demonstrates understanding of how technology supports Manulife's strategy

• Strong detail orientation

• Awareness of full-technology stack

• Strong communicator who can negotiate effectively with business to clarify needs vs. wants/likes in order to balance business direction/requirements with cost of development and risk

• An effective facilitator for the Team to deliver incremental and iterative units of business value

• Has a natural ability to breakdown, decompose and describe business needs into Stories supporting an iterative and incremental delivery model

• Mentors Associate Business Analysts

• Seeks coaching from experts

• Attends advanced training on analysis skills and business knowledge

• Demonstrates all core skills, and good interpersonal skills for the role

• Good working / background knowledge of practice area

• Use and combine knowledge of the discipline and the market to formulate the right approach

• Fit for purpose, though may lack refinement

• Sees actions partly in terms of longer-term goals

• Understands the corporate climate & culture

• Strong knowledge of the business

• Constantly learns from both success and failure

• Good organizational and problem-solving abilities that enable you to manage through creative abrasion

• Good verbal and written communication; able to effectively articulate technical vision, possibilities, and outcomes

Decision Authorities:

• Able to achieve most tasks using own judgement

• Can lead smaller groups where required

• Good analytical skills, copes with complex situations through deliberate analysis and planning

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock and Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact

recruitment@manulife.com

.

title: Senior Operations Analyst
description:
Senior Operations Analyst


You will work within a team of analysts as a single point-of-contact for internal and external stakeholders, managing the intake of requests and changes across all Interac Corp. services in a complex, multi-vendor environment with the primary goals being to ensure seamless communication and timely fulfillment of requests. You will be responsible for the day-to-day management and support of Corporate Applications. In addition, you will work with in concert with the Implementations team to support the smooth transition and integration to BAU support for new customer onboarding and new or changed product and service implementations










Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

title: Senior Sampling Coordinator
description:
Ipsos is the world’s third-largest market research company, present in 90 markets and employing more than 18,000 people. Our passionately curious research professionals, analysts and scientists have built unique multi-specialist capabilities that provide the true understanding and powerful insights into the actions, opinions, and motivations of citizens, consumers, patients, customers or employees. We serve more than 5000 clients across the world with 75 business solutions.

Founded in France in 1975, Ipsos is listed on the Euronext Paris since July 1st, 1999. The company is part of the SBF 120 and the Mid-60 index and is eligible for the Deferred Settlement Service (SRD). ISIN code FR0000073298, Reuters ISOS.PA, Bloomberg IPS: FPwww.ipsos.com

We are currently looking for a Sampling Coordinator inToronto or Montreal.

The sampling coordinator will be responsible for executing the sampling frame for recruitment into the custom panel as well as ongoing sampling activities for follow-up projects. This will include external and internal sample sources management, sample pull executions, performance, and financial tracking, working with Scripting and Panel Manager (PM) on production deployments.

Essential Job Functions

  • Be the primary point of contact in the sampling area for PM, scripting, and sampling source vendors, managing the sampling process from start to finish. This includes everything from managing sample vendors, including tracking of their performance as well as billing, creating sampling frames based on client specifications, executing balancing frames, creating sample availability reports, pulling sample based on spec and internal exclusions as well as panel availability, report to PM on sample performance and coordinate fieldwork activities accordingly. This involves working closely with the PM and scripting.
  • Coordinate with global research and operational teams to build sampling frames as required by the client (i.e. social-economic, education, income questions by country).
  • Manage internal and external sample sources including, feasibility, pricing, performance, and engage PM/scripting as needed for new source system set up and technical issues.
  • Manage the sampling strategy execution process closely to ensure that the scope and budget are maintained and tracked and that the project and client specifications are adhered to.
  • Work closely with PMs to manage panel demo and responsiveness composition, as relating to sample replenishment targets creation and execution.
  • Master interface for panel platform, including a full understanding of project specifications, member management, data integration, and reporting capability as relevant to the sampling activities.
  • Master IPS sampling platform to accommodate recruitment directly from existing iSay panels into the ICP custom panel.
  • Master IPS client sampling software to create and execute complex balancing sample selection schemes.
  • Master off-system data manipulation in excel needed to achieve sampling objectives.
  • Create and load sample groups into individual projects of the panel platform and communicate with PM regarding deployment activities as well as with scripting regarding quota set up.

Required Skills and Abilities

  • 2to3 years of applicable experience in either online market research, advertising agency, digital marketing, or complex project management
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
  • Panel Management Software knowledge (Questback / Tivian) is a plus
  • Demonstrated a high level of attention to detail in a fast-moving and complex multi-region project environment.
  • Demonstrate strong data management skillset, including the ability to manipulate data in an error-free fashion.
  • Strong QA skills to be able to proof own and others’ work.
  • Ability to negotiate terms with various vendors and motivate strong vendor performance.
  • Ability to thrive in a team-oriented, collaborative environment, coordinating a variety of roles and resources to bring projects to fruition
  • Ability to organize and prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
  • Proficient using Word, PowerPoint.
  • Advanced expertise in Excel for database management and data manipulation purposes.
  • Advanced knowledge of IPS(platform) and client sample IPS processes.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be motivated, passionate, and career-oriented maintaining a culture of innovation and continue the desire for skill-building.

Ipsos’ Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

Ipsos recognizes the necessity of building an inclusive culture that values each employee’s individuality and diverse perspectives. For more than 40 years, our mission has been to generate and analyze data about society, markets, brands, and behaviors to provide our clients with the insights that elevate their understanding of the world. This could not be fulfilled without Ipsos’ diverse employees who compile and analyze this data—they are the essence of who we are and what we do.

We are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees, creating an environment that promotes inclusion, and allowing employees from all walks of life to flourish. Ipsos encourages our employees to act in a respectful and responsible manner, in line with codes of best practices concerning diversity and inclusion, human rights, equality, and civility for every individual.

Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.



Required Skills


Required Experience

title: Lead Data Scientist (remote)
description:
Company Description

You will join a world-class team of engineers and data scientists from Facebook, Uber, Amazon and Google. We are a fast growing consulting firm based in Toronto with clients ranging from leading startups building impactful technologies to Fortune 500 companies looking to scale their engineering and data capabilities. 

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Science Lead who will:

  • Partner closely with our clients' executive and technical teams to guide their decisions relating to AI, analytics, data engineering and data in general

  • Proactively identify and champion projects that solve complex problems across multiple domains

  • Apply specialized skills and fundamental data science methods (e.g. experimental design, recommender systems and machine learning when needed) to inform improvements to our clients' businesses

  • Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: work closely with stakeholders to build models, tables or schemas that support our clients' business processes

  • Empower teams both internal and external to build and maintain actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data products

Qualifications

  • BS (or higher, e.g., MS, or PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or Statistics
  • 3-7 years of commercial experience as a data science lead solving high impact business problems, including 1 years leading and maintaining high performance data science teams
  • Extensive experience using Python including a strong grasp of object oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals
  • Experience building data pipelines and driving ETL design decisions
  • Experience delivering business impact through analysis and data products
  • Technical leadership and management experience where you can jump into the code to the level that your peers admire and respect, and are also interested in helping mentor your peers
  • Experience creating data product strategies, shipping data products, iterating after launch, and trying again
  • Strong ability to prioritize and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences alike
  • Working knowledge of Snowflake
  • Devops experiences a plus


Additional Information

We have very competitive compensation.

Work on cool projects based on your interests and skills. We believe in accountability and NOT micro-management.
