title: Ingénieur de Production
description:
QUARTZ CO.

Fondée en 1997, Quartz Co. s’est taillé une réputation de choix sur le marché canadien et ailleurs dans le monde grâce à la qualité de confection de ses manteaux qui sont chauds, légers et résistants au froid hivernal. Du design à la confection, toutes les opérations sont basées au Québec (Canada) ce qui permet à l’entreprise de travailler avec une main d’œuvre qualifiée et soucieuse de préserver un savoir-faire reconnu à travers le monde. On retrouve aujourd’hui les produits Quartz Co. dans plus de 275 magasins à travers 20 pays incluant le Japon, la Corée, la Norvège, la France, l’Allemagne et la Suisse. Pour plus de détails sur l’entreprise, visitez quartz-co.ca et @quartzco

En collaboration avec le VP Production, l’ingénieur de production aura pour principale responsabilité la coordination et la supervision des opérations, du flux de production et du personnel des différentes usines de Quartz Co. Le titulaire du poste se verra aussi confier divers projets ayant pour but d’améliorer les processus entre la réception des commandes et l’expédition des manteaux. Que ce soit l’optimisation de procédures existantes ou l’installation et la mise en fonction de nouvelles machines, l’Ingénieur de production implantera des méthodes de travail et assurera une amélioration continue des opérations de Quartz Co.

Responsabilités :

  • Coordonner l’approvisionnement des matières premières du passage de la commande à sa réception ;
  • Coordonner la mise en production des lots de production de manteaux dans les usines de Quartz Co. ;
  • Participer à l’implantation de nouvelles procédures et méthodes de travail à travers le département des opérations ;
  • Participer à la mise en place d’outils TI à travers l’organisation ;
  • Participer à des projets d’amélioration continue des flux de production, notamment les projets d’intégration de machines automatisées ;
  • Soutenir l’équipe de production au quotidien ;
  • Effectuer un lien entre les équipes de ventes et les activités de production.

Qualifications essentielles :

  • Diplôme en génie industriel ou tout autre domaine connexe jugé pertinent ;
  • 0 à 2 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire ;
  • Bilinguisme (FR/EN), tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit ;
  • Maîtrise de la suite Office, particulièrement Microsoft Excel ;
  • Facilité avec les technologies ;
  • Intérêt pour l’industrie du textile ;
  • Grand sens de l’initiative et de prise de décision ;
  • Rigueur au travail, souci du détail et du travail bien fait ;
  • Sens de l’organisation et des responsabilités ;
  • Motivation à progresser dans une organisation en pleine croissance.

Détail du contrat:

  • Temps plein, Permanent
  • Date de début: Printemps 2022
skills: ['Temps plein, Permanent']

title: Performance Analyst
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview:

 

The ECAN Aggregate strategy brings significant focus on performance, logistics, and sustainability with the underlying megatrend of digital.   The Senior Analyst, Business data and systems integration is responsible for commercial, logistics and sustainability analysis, reporting, development of cost saving and circular economy efforts including trial and execution of digital solutions, process mechanization and improvement, and supporting operational and business cycle activities such as strategic plan, inventory optimization, and customer portfolio analysis.      

Responsibilities:

 

Safety  

  • Demonstrates an awareness and commitment to a safe work environment.  
  • Understands the safety objectives of the organization and supports these by taking action to ensure that unsafe practices or non-compliant behaviors do not occur.
  • Promotes Health & Safety initiatives/program and participates in Safety activities within the Product Lines.

 

Data Analytics and Optimization of Results

  • Supports the collection, assessment, and interpretation of data from various systems and sources to develop forward looking solutions. This includes analyzing data and articulating results and business drivers, applying statistical methods to uncover underlying trends and improve forecasting techniques, and make data-backed recommendations for business improvements. This may also include inventory planning and optimization activities.  Results will be shared with Territory and Commercial Managers in periodic results reviews.          

 

Business Cycle and Strategic Support

  • Support the Commercial Manager to prepare annual business cycle activities such as the commercial plan, strategic plan, and price reviews. This will include market analysis, benchmarking and competitor / customer analysis, data extraction and analysis, and data-backed recommendations.  
  • This role may also support special projects such as reserve position analysis and long term action plans for circular economy growth.  

 

Mechanization and Development of Digital Solutions

  • Support the mechanization of processes across the region in alignment with the ECAN approach, and will support analysis, trial, execution, training, troubleshooting and analytics of various digital solutions such as TMS, online bidding platforms, reporting and analysis tools, remote dispatch and other innovative digital solutions.  
  • This role will also develop and maintain various information systems and databases.  

 

Relationship with Others

  • Interacts with the market area General Manager, ECAN Commercial Performance manager, area commercial and territory managers, local market Logistics managers and teams, and Procurement.   Regular interaction with Lafarge IT team, external software providers, and external haul service providers.  

 

Specific Accountabilities:

 

Analytics and Strategy:

  • Complete data gathering, assessment, and interpretation activities and market research, to support the annual business cycle activities such as the commercial plan, strategic plan, and logistics strategy; systems include SAP, APEX, Salesforce, TAC, Qlikview reporting monitors, and others.    
  • Leverage data from internal and external sources to uncover trends and articulate business drivers, and leverage statistical techniques to improve forward-looking decisions.  
  • Assist commercial team in customer portfolio analysis and optimization including statistical analysis on pricing and elasticity.
  • Assist logistics team with hauler management and route analysis and optimization, zone mapping reviews, as well as TMS implementation and associated data validation, reporting, and geofence management.  
  • Develop executive level presentations outlining progress, strategies, recommendations, and ad hoc requests as needed.  
  • Complete market research for and champion key sustainability initiatives such as recycled aggregates and emissions reductions.  

 

Performance optimization and analysis:

  • Collect data from various systems, analyze, and report on business results, trends, drivers and risks / opportunities. Leverage data to improve forecasting and support business decisions.   Complete periodic reviews with Territory and Commercial Managers.  
  • Mechanize manual reporting processes and support implementation of various digital solutions and information systems; this may include research, trials, analysis of outcomes, building business cases, and supporting the implementation activities.
  • Support the monthly inventory review to balance production and sales (SPI) and make recommendations to optimize inventory and achieve market targets.
  • Complete carrier performance reviews (safety compliance, margins, etc)
  • Initiate remote dispatch program/trials, train and troubleshoot with weighmasters, and provide analytics.
Dimensions
  • This position reports to the General Manager with a dotted line to the ECAN Commercial and Logistics Performance Manager.
Qualifications:

 

Education, Skills & Experience

  • An undergraduate degree in business, engineering, or construction management, logistics or supply chain management
  • Understanding of digital tools and processes  
  • Expert MS Office skills

 

Competencies

  • Strong focus on data management and analytics
  • Effective decision making with data backed analysis
  • Results oriented â€“ disciplined and process oriented
  • Excellent people skills â€“ able to develop effective working relationships internally and externally
  • Strong work ethic, willingness to work on a variety of projects and ability to multi-task
  • Ability to work efficiently in a fast paced, dynamic environment and under pressure
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Effective computer and systems skills
LafargeHolcim:

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.  

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodations are available on request for  candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Data Analyst
description:
As a Data Analyst at Behaviour, you will be responsible for the implementation and maintenance of effective tracking tools used for performance and quality reporting and analysis of assigned projects.
 
As data expert on your project, you will be part of a multidisciplinary team, and your role will be to ensure analytical insight about challenges faced during the different phases of production.

In this role you will

  • Develop telemetry during game production to ensure that player behaviour can be analysed;
  • Identify, develop, and provide analytical answers to challenges faced by partners involved in game development;
  • Develop optimized and clear output/outcome (dashboard reports and analyses) to meet the needs identified;
  • Promote knowledge and understanding of player behaviour at studio level through clear and well-documented analyses;
  • Establish strong working relationships with partners and colleagues built on trust and proximity;
  • Work with different teams to adapt approaches and tools to solve complex problems and find good balance between velocity, accuracy, and quality.

What we're looking for

  • 2-3 years of experience in the field of analytics;
  • Excellent knowledge of how to use databases, particularly complicated data processing of large data sets with SQL and NoSQL;
  • Excellent data visualization skills (Power BI is a plus);
  • Curious about what can be learned from data analysis;
  • Autonomy and excellent organization skills;
  • Thrive when faced with challenges and uncertainty.

Dans ce rôle, vous devrez

  •  Développer la télémétrie lors de la phase de production du jeu afin de s'assurer que le comportement des joueurs pourra être analysé ;
  • Identifier, proposer et développer des réponses analytiques aux enjeux des partenaires impliqués sur un jeu ;
  • Développer des sorties de résultats (tableaux de bords, rapports, analyses) optimisées et lisibles qui répondront aux besoins identifiés ;
  • Promouvoir la connaissance et la compréhension des joueurs à travers la compagnie grâce à des analyses claires et documentées ;
  • Nouer des relations fortes avec vos partenaires et collègues afin de travailler dans un contexte de confiance et proximité ;
  • S’épanouir face au défi et à l'incertitude : en travaillant avec différentes équipes, vous devrez résoudre des problèmes, adapter votre approche et vos outils pour répondre à des questions complexes et trouver le juste équilibre entre rapidité, précision et qualité des différentes approches.  

Ce que nous recherchons

  • Sont essentiels :  
  • 2-3 ans d'expérience dans un domaine analytique ;
  • Excellentes compétences en manipulation de bases de données : traitement complexe de larges ensembles de données à l’aide de SQL, NoSQL ;
  • Excellentes compétences en visualisation de données (Power BI est un atout) ;
  • Curieux des enseignements à tirer des analyses de données ;
  • Autonomie et sens aigu de l’organisation ;
  • Bonnes compétences de communication ;
  • Anglais courant ;
  • Joueur d’équipe (l’humour est un atout).

  • Sont des atouts :  
  • Compétences en programmation: une expérience avec Python / R ;
  • Expérience des outils AWS et/ou Snowflake ;
  • Expérience dans l’univers du jeu vidéo.
En tant qu’Analyste de données chez Behaviour, vous êtes responsable de la mise en place et de la maintenance d’outils de suivi performants, vous permettant de produire des rapports et des analyses de qualité sur la performance des projets qui vous sont assignés.  

En tant qu’expert des données sur votre projet, vous travaillez au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire et avez pour rôle d’assurer une vision analytique sur les différents défis rencontrés lors de la production et la croissance d’un jeu vidéo.
skills: ['Develop optimized and clear output/outcome (dashboard reports and analyses) to meet the needs identified;', 'Excellent data visualization skills (Power BI is a plus);', 'Curious about what can be learned from data analysis;', 'Anglais courant\xa0;', 'Promote knowledge and understanding of player behaviour at studio level through clear and well-documented analyses;', 'Excellent knowledge of how to use databases, particularly complicated data processing of large data sets with SQL and NoSQL;', 'Thrive when faced with challenges and uncertainty.', 'Establish strong working relationships with partners and colleagues built on trust and proximity;', '2-3 years of experience in the field of analytics;', 'Work with different teams to adapt approaches and tools to solve complex problems and find good balance between velocity, accuracy, and quality.', 'Develop telemetry during game production to ensure that player behaviour can be analysed;', 'Identify, develop, and provide analytical answers to challenges faced by partners involved in game development;']

title: Data Analyst (calibrations)
description:
Description de l'entreprise

ExPretio propose des solutions avancées de Revenue Management et de tarification optimale en transport de passagers. Ses clients sont de grandes firmes internationales qui souhaitent améliorer leur profitabilité en appliquant les dernières techniques de recherche opérationnelle, de modélisation économétrique et de forage de données.

Situés dans le secteur du Plateau Mont-Royal à Montréal, les bureaux d’ExPretio allient architecture industrielle et design moderne. À seulement quelques minutes de deux campus universitaires, facilement accessible en transport en commun et entourée de nombreux restaurants et cafés branchés, l’entreprise offre à ses employés un environnement de travail ouvert et décontracté, où la croissance professionnelle, l’esprit d’équipe et le sens de l’initiative sont fortement valorisés.

Description du poste

En Revenue Management, la tarification optimale en transport de passagers est fortement dépendante de la qualité des modèles de prévision de la demande.

Le candidat travaillera à l’exploitation des données afin de comprendre le processus d’arrivée et d’achat des clients. Cette analyse permettra par la suite au candidat de produire des modèles de prévision de qualité adaptés au contexte commercial des transporteurs.

Rôles et responsabilités

 Sous la supervision du responsable des services clients, le titulaire du poste sera en charge des activités suivantes :

  • Analyse des données historiques des clients
  • Mise à jour des fichiers de calibration du modèle
  • Recommandation des paramètres du modèle
  • Evaluation du modèle de prévision de la demande
  • Rédaction de rapports en anglais et en français
  • Etude de la performance des prévisions chez les clients
  • Création de « templates » d’analyse ou de « dashboard » à l’aide d’outils BI
Qualifications

  • Baccalauréat en mathématiques, statistique, informatique décisionnelle ou discipline connexe
  • Compétences en analyse et en manipulation de gros volume de données
  • Habiletés à communiquer avec clarté et précision, verbalement et à l’écrit en français et en anglais
  • Apte à travailler dans un environnement dynamique et à respecter des échéanciers
  • Autonomie, esprit d’analyse, attention aux détails, excellent sens de l’organisation
  • Compétences en méthodologies statistiques (mesures d’erreurs, analyse graphique, etc) : la familiarité avec les techniques d’apprentissage automatique ou le revenue management serait un plus

Compétences techniques

  • Connaissances SQL
  • Connaissance d’outils BI (Power Pivot, Power BI)
  • Expérience avec la suite Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point)
  • Familiarité avec Windows et Linux
  • Expérience avec un outil de manipulation statistique serait un atout (R, Python, Matlab, etc.)


Informations complémentaires

Avantages sociaux

  • 5 journées personnelles par année.
  • Horaires flexibles et conciliation travail-famille.
  • Possibilité de télétravail.
  • Programme de bonis annuels.
  • Assurance collective incluant le dentaire
  • Service de télémédecine pour les employés et leur famille.
  • Primes pour référence d’employés.
  • Laptop dernière génération.
  • Programme de formation continue.
  • Remboursement des activités de formation et de perfectionnement.
  • Participation de l’entreprise aux abonnements sportifs.
  • Participation de l’entreprise aux abonnements de transport en commun.
skills: ['Laptop dernière génération.', 'Rôles et responsabilités']

title: Data Analyst
description:
Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.  

Vous rêvez d’être au cœur de l’analyse des données de performance d’une entreprise d’envergure mondiale? Vous avez envie de contribuer à la mise en place de stratégies d’affaires? Voici l’offre que vous attendiez!

Votre future équipe

Faire la différence, voilà comment Premier Tech se distingue. Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.

Votre futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Concevoir et déployer les requêtes de données requises
  • Résoudre divers enjeux et identifier des questions de recherche en analysant des données
  • Participer à l’intégration des applications de gestion des données aux systèmes existants
  • Élaborer les politiques et les procédures relatives à la consultation des bases de données
  • Développer et maintenir les processus de contrôle des changements et de tests
  • Communiquer les résultats aux diverses parties prenantes
  • Collaborer avec différentes équipes

Compétences requises

  • Trois années d’expérience dans un rôle d’analyse de données dans un contexte de ressources humaines
  • Membre de l’Ordre CRHA ou CRIA du Québec – un atout
  • Facilité à comprendre et à vulgariser des données complexes
  • Curiosité
  • Excellentes habiletés communicationnelles
  • Esprit d’équipe
  • Maîtrise de l’anglais, parlé et écrit

Votre futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Ces mots vous parlent?

Processus RH, HCM

Vos yeux s’illuminent à la lecture de cette offre rêvée? Postulez dès maintenant, nous attendons votre candidature avec impatience!

title: Process Improvement Analyst III
description:
Relevant du gestionnaire de la planification et de l’analyse financière, le titulaire du poste prépare des prévisions, des budgets, des statistiques opérationnelles et des analyses financières afin d’appuyer la prise de décisions liées à Moneris Services sur site (MSS) et aux opérations de l’équipe de la haute direction. La personne retenue s’occupera également de l’analyse des renseignements opérationnels dans le but d’évaluer, d’interpréter et de prévoir le rendement de MSS, et ainsi appuyer la prise de décision des cadres, la prévision et la planification. La préparation des rapports de gestion pertinents est nécessaire au bon déroulement des activités des partenaires financiers de l’entreprise ainsi qu’au développement de modèles de prévision et de planification évolutifs et efficaces. Le titulaire du poste doit également faire preuve d’excellentes compétences organisationnelles et interpersonnelles, en plus d’être curieux et en mesure de gérer plusieurs projets à la fois. De plus, dans le cadre de ce poste, une forte capacité à élaborer des modèles analytiques et à les garder à jour ainsi qu’une bonne compréhension d’un environnement d’affaires dynamique sont essentielles.

Principales responsabilités :

  • Préparer le plan de fonctionnement annuel et des prévisions régulières pour Moneris Services sur site à l’aide de statistiques opérationnelles et d’analyses financières, en tenant compte de la stratégie d’entreprise, en permettant l’automatisation et en tirant profit de données afin d’améliorer constamment le processus (documenter ses hypothèses est essentiel)
  • Recueillir des données, les analyser, les résumer et les utiliser pour préparer de précieuses analyses de rendement opérationnel ainsi que des rapports pour la direction en faisant attention de souligner les principaux risques, problèmes et occasions liés au rendement de l’entreprise dans le but de formuler des recommandations à l’équipe de direction
  • Utiliser des analyses de données novatrices, des analyses statistiques ainsi que des indicateurs clés pour déterminer, qualifier et quantifier les mesures de rendement opérationnel, y compris l’analyse des tendances et la compréhension des causes principales
  • Utiliser et créer des modèles financiers, en plus d’utiliser des systèmes financiers et des applications de Microsoft afin d’accomplir ses tâches et automatiser le travail
  • S’occuper de l’élaboration, de l’interprétation et de la mise en œuvre de concepts financiers à des fins de planification et de contrôle financier
  • Appuyer les partenaires financiers de l’entreprise en fournissant une expertise financière complète des décisions de l’entreprise en analysant les taux de rendement, la dépréciation, les exigences en matière d’affectation de fonds, les possibilités d’investissement, et le rendement des investissements, en validant les hypothèses et en respectant les exigences gouvernementales, au besoin

Exigences minimales relatives au poste :

  • Baccalauréat en affaires, en commerce, en comptabilité, en finances ou dans un domaine connexe, un titre professionnel (CPA, CFA) ou une maîtrise en administration des affaires considérés comme un atout important
  • De 3 à 5 ans d’expérience en planification et analyse financières
  • Bonne connaissance de Windows et de la suite Microsoft Office et solides compétences en création de modèles de gestion dans Excel requises
  • Bilinguisme (anglais et français) requis
  • Expérience en analyse financière et en soutien opérationnel dans le domaine des opérations, de la chaîne d’approvisionnement ou de la logistique, de la gestion des stocks ou expérience pertinente dans l’industrie des services technologiques considérée comme fortement souhaitable
  • Être en mesure d’interpréter, de comprendre et d’équilibrer des renseignements et des données complexes afin d’appuyer une prise de décision en temps opportun

Reporting to the Manager, Financial Planning & Analysis, the position is responsible for preparing forecasts, budgets, operating statistics and financial analysis to support executive decision making for Moneris Field Services (MFS) / Operations. The role will also be responsible for the analysis of operational information to drive insights to assess, interpret and predict business performance of MFS to support management decisions and for forecasting and planning purposes. This role is responsible for preparing the appropriate management reporting to support the Finance Business Partners, developing scalable and efficient models for forecasting and planning. The incumbent must also encompass exceptional organizational and interpersonal skills, be inquisitive and agile while managing multiple deliverables. Furthermore, this role requires a strong ability to develop and maintain analytical models with an understanding of the changing business environment.

Key accountabilities include:

  • Prepares annual operating plan and regular forecast for Moneris Field Services using operating statistics and financial analysis which reflects the corporate strategy and incorporates automation and leverages data to continuously improve the process and with the appropriate documentation of assumptions
  • Gathers, analyzes, summarizes, and prepares valuable operational performance analysis and management reporting by highlighting key business performance risks, issues and opportunities in order to support recommendations for management
  • Uses innovative data analysis, statistical analysis and key metrics to identify, qualify and quantify operational performance measurements, including analyzing trends and understanding root cause
  • Uses and creates financial models, uses financial systems, and Microsoft applications to complete tasks and automate work.
  • Responsible for developing, interpreting, and implementing financial concepts for financial planning and control.
  • Support the Finance Business Partner by providing comprehensive financial expertise for business decisions by analyzing rates of return, depreciation, capital appropriations requirements, investment opportunities, investment performance, validating assumptions, and governmental requirements, as needed

Minimum position requirements:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Business/ Commerce/ Accounting/ Finance or a related field of study; Professional designation (CPA, CFA) or MBA would be a strong asset
  • 3 to 5 years of working experience in FP&A
  • Proficient with Microsoft Windows/ MS Office Applications; Strong Excel Business Modeling skills required
  • Bilingualism in English & French required
  • Financial analysis/ business support experience in operations, supply chain, logistics, inventory management, or related experience in the technology services industry would be strongly preferred
  • Possesses the ability to interpret, comprehend and balance complex information and data to support timely decision making

 

To reduce the risk of COVID-19 transmission and to facilitate a safe return to the office for all employees, clients and vendors, Moneris has developed a vaccination standard that requires all employees and contract resources to be fully vaccinated in order to attend company premises, company events or conduct business travel on behalf of Moneris (and provide proof).  Bona fide exemptions may be requested in accordance with legally protected grounds. 

Note: We welcome and encourage applications from indigenous people, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

title: Business Process Improvement Analyst
description:
REVISED/REPOST

Department: Planning, Process Improvement, Strategy and Innovation
Campus: Barrie
Salary Range: $60,337 - $75,422
Classification: Administrative
Status: Full-time
Posting Date: December 14, 2021

Reporting to the Manager, Process Improvement, Strategy and Innovation, the incumbent is responsible for designing and facilitating team-based business process improvement initiatives focused on enhancing institutional efficiency, effectiveness and capacity while leveraging opportunities to save time, reduce workload, redirect resources and enhance the overall quality of the student experience at Georgian College. Specific duties include, but are not limited to:

• Developing and presenting proposals and/or business plans on a range of issues related to information technology (or its use) to include problem identification, costs, benefits and options
• Conducting or overseeing needs business analysis, feasibility studies, cost / benefit analysis of requests for applications, information systems or related applications
• Responsible for the planning, designing, acquisition, implementation of new or changed administrative systems software
• Elicits business and system requirements through conducting or leading interviews, group (focus) meetings, workshops and job shadowing
• Documents analysis, use cases and scenarios following best practices. Developing workflow and process flow diagrams and identify improvement opportunities with the ability to deliver effective presentations
• Working closely with functional areas, to optimize business processes and systems to improve departmental as well as cross-departmental functions
• Providing leadership on small to mid-size operational initiatives and drives the requirements definition on implementations of or enhancements to software applications and their integrations
• Working with IT and key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies
• Performing functional analysis and design, defining, and documenting detailed business requirements
• Participating in the systems implementation process by reviewing acceptance criteria, QA test strategy and ensuring post-implementation support
• Preparing cost-benefit analyses to aid in decisions on system implementation and able to create business solutions/system design that increase competitive advantage
• Translating customer business goals and objectives into strategy and tactical plans
• Determining user needs, and proposes systems solutions based on requirements
• Guiding small to medium size project teams, develops detailed project plans, schedules and budgets
• Managing the day to day operational and tactical aspects of small to medium scale projects including priority and goal setting
• Co-ordinating and maintaining project control processes
• Playing a central role in project planning and implementation from design/prototype phases through to system roll-out; ensures on time and on-budget implementation
• Providing project leadership to unit staff/project teams/vendors/system analysts/consultants
• Utilizing extensive knowledge of PMBOK, project management methodologies and practices, from conception through to completion
• Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Successfully completed a two-year postsecondary diploma/degree in Business, Information Technology, Project Management, Information Management Science or a related field
• Designation in Process Improvement (Lean Management, 6 Sigma) is an asset
• PMP (Project Management Professional) is an asset
• A minimum of five years' experience in applying continuous quality improvement methodologies
• Experience in facilitating, developing and implementing business process redesign projects, specifically in business process mapping, analysis and design
• Experience in project management and group facilitation
• Experience in applying change management strategies in large, complex organizations
• Experience in preparing written materials to communicate concepts, plans and results to various audiences. Written materials would include: proposals, briefings, reports, newsletters, articles and bulletins
• Well-versed with software development life-cycle and development practices, technical aspects of RPA development.
• Experience working closely with technical (IT) staff in the implementation of software or processes
• Systems Development Life Cycle
• Experience in relationship building and team leadership
• Sound working knowledge of various methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma & Project Management

Georgian College supports diversity, equity and a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. Georgian College is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace. If you are contacted to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please advise the interview coordinator of any accommodations needed with respect to any materials or processes used to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process.

Alternate formats will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process.

Georgian College has a COVID-19 vaccination procedure in place. As a condition of employment, employees are required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 to work on any campus, or a facility owned, operated or controlled by Georgian College unless they have a valid medical or religious belief/creed reason for not getting vaccinated, which reason will be considered on a case by case basis and which will be subject to the College's accommodation processes.

Applications for this position must be received by 11:59 p.m. on December 20, 2021. While we thank all applicants, only those contacted for an interview will be acknowledged.

title: Healthcare Data Analyst (fully remote)
description:
Clarivate™ is a global leader in providing solutions to accelerate the lifecycle of innovation. Our bold mission is to help customers solve some of the world’s most complex problems by providing actionable information and insights that reduce the time from new ideas to life-changing inventions in the areas of science and intellectual property. We help customers discover, protect and commercialize their inventions using our trusted subscription and technology-based solutions coupled with deep domain expertise.

We now have more than 8,500 colleagues in over 40 countries worldwide, and we work with over 200 partners to deliver value and success for our customers. Today, Clarivate is a publicly traded company, listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker NYSE:CLVT.

Clarivate is committed to building, nurturing, and developing a diverse culture of belonging where new colleagues can bring their authentic self to work every day! Join us!

We are actively seeking a Healthcare Data Analyst in our MedTech Data team.  This position is remote based.

Position responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain processes and systems to analyze structured & unstructured “big data” sources.
  • Develop and code software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources with an emphasis on US medical devices and supplies markets. 
  • Understand the worldview and pain points of Clarivate customers, working closely with them as a problem-solver. From Fortune 500 companies to smaller startups, you will converse with high-profile clients regularly and be expected to both present and defend conclusions to them.
  • Evaluate data outputs with an keen eye for details, proactively finding potential errors and omissions.
  • Identify opportunities and issues for data analysis and experiments, with bias towards driving customer delight.

Personal traits:

  • Passionate about data and have hands-on experience wrangling through large data using SQL and BI tools. 
  • Effective communicator who can explain complex ideas using clear and concise language, including through written communication.
  • Strong ability in communicating directly with customers, helping to deliver and interpret data, while soliciting feedback for future improvements.
  • Excel at collaborating with a diverse group of internal colleagues, including subject matter experts, product managers, sales leaders, technical experts, and other client-facing analysts.   
  • Solutions oriented

Education/Knowledge/skills required:

  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in relevant subject area (science or business)
  • You have strong quantitative foundations, as evidenced by your educational and professional background. 
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel (e.g. pivot tables, VLOOKUP, INDEX MATCH).
  • Proficient with SQL
  • Experience/strong interest in converting unstructured datasets into broadly usable data models.
  • Experience/strong interest in building market forecast models.
  • You know how to deliver an effective presentation.

Preferred:

  • Experience from life sciences
  • Advanced degree (MA, MBA, MPH, MS, or PhD in life sciences, social sciences or statistics) and/or relevant experience in the medical device, healthcare, market research or consulting sectors.

It is the policy of Clarivate to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Clarivate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: Data Science Intern
description:
Overview:

Analysis Group is one of the largest international economic consulting firms, with more than 1,000 professionals across 14 offices in North America, Europe, and Asia. Since 1981, we have provided expertise in economics, finance, health care analytics, and strategy to top law firms, Fortune Global 500 companies, and government agencies worldwide. Our internal experts, together with our network of affiliated experts from academia, industry, and government, offer our clients exceptional breadth and depth of expertise.

 

Analysis Group provides economic, financial, and strategy consulting to law firms, corporations, and government agencies. At Analysis Group, Data Science is a center of excellence within a company that already has decades of experience focused on analysis involving data. The Data Science team is charged with collaborating with leading internal and external academic experts to find creative solutions to some of the most challenging and high-value problems we face.

 

We are currently seeking a Data Science Intern to join our team. The ideal candidate should be passionate about working on cutting edge research and analytical services for Fortune 500 companies, global pharma/biotech firms and leaders in industries such as finance, energy and life sciences. The Data Science Intern will be a contributing member to client engagements and have the opportunity to work with our network of world-class experts and thought leaders.

 

Job Functions and Responsibilities:

The Data Science Intern will help develop, maintain and teach new tools and methodologies related to data science and high performance computing. This position will also help Analysis Group in maintaining our leadership position in terms of advancing methodology and data analytics. The Data Science Intern will be responsible for staying abreast of new developments in technology relating to data science, to share more broadly with Analysis Group.

 

Key responsibilities for this position will include:

  • Working with project teams to address data science/computing challenges
  • Identifying opportunities for technology to enhance service offerings
  • Acting as a resource and participating in client engagements and research as part of the project team
  • Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of computing tools, providing technical training and helping to grow the in-house knowledge base, specifically in a Linux environment

 

Examples of activities for the Data Science Intern will include:

  • Developing data engineering and machine learning production systems for full stack data science projects
  • Using natural language processing methodologies to work with EMR data, social media data and other unstructured data
  • Optimizing procedures for managing and accessing large databases (e.g., insurance claims, electronic health records, financial transactions)
  • Creating interactive analytics portals and data visualizations (e.g., using R/Shiny, Python/Flask, D3)
  • Building and maintaining high performance computing (HPC) tools on grid and cloud computing environments
  • Developing and reviewing software and packages in R, Python and other Object Oriented Languages
  • Establishing optimized procedures for repetitive or computationally intensive tasks (C, C++, Cuda-C)

 

 Qualifications:

  • Pursuing an advanced degree is required, preferably in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or related subjects.
  • Significant experience working within a Linux environment required, experience with Docker and front-end development using a Javascript framework (e.g., Vue.js, Angular) is highly preferred.
  • Strong credentials and experience in database management and/or data visualization is preferred.
  • Demonstrates strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.
  • Project experience with Python and/or R is preferred.
  • Familiar with online/cloud computing/storage (e.g. Azure, AWS) is preferred.
  • Demonstrated experience working on project teams and collaborating with others.

 

How to Apply:

When submitting your application, please include a resume, all unofficial transcripts (undergraduate and graduate if applicable) and a cover letter.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP  here.

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

 

 

AG is committed to take all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families and communities.  As of October 4th, 2021, only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our offices and confirmation of vaccination status will be requested. As a new AG employee, you will be need to provide proof of vaccination in order to access our offices.  We continue to monitor and assess the situation on an ongoing basis.

title: Fall 2022 Co-op: Junior Project Controls Analyst
description:
Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month. We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today. Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible. Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs?  If yes, consider the following opportunity: Start your career with a strong foundation and spend your Co-op work term with us! Our Co-op Program gives students the opportunity to be involved in meaningful projects, contribute real work, rewarding opportunities and building an inclusive future for everyone. We have a long history of investing in the next generation and we’re committed to making Rogers the top destination for young people to start and grow their careers in Canada.  At Rogers, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities - let’s make your possible. About the BU: 
PMO Governance and Controls is at the heart and start of project deployment and controls. Working within capital management and project accounting, the incumbent will work closely with a high performing and technologically driven team. We are looking for an enthusiastic and highly motivated individual to assist our team of Capital Management Analysts and continue to drive innovation and project controls. This entry level role will allow the incumbent to accumulate experience within the larger area of capital management but more importantly will empower and promote creativity and critical thinking all while liaising with different members of the team, across the country, from engineering to project management.  What you will do…Assist overall CAPEX spend targets by setting up project budgets on a timely basisReview CAPEX portfolio and assist team with the identification and closing of legacy projectsReview inventory and other related hurdles across portfolio and work with stakeholders to help clear outSupport the Manager with Capital Spend reporting packages, business cases, presentations, and ad hoc analysisWork with the Oracle Financial Systems & Tools (ADI, Discoverer, Smartview, Noetix) to extract and automate data flowsDesign/develop tools and systems that allow the team to achieve greater efficiency What you will bring… Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or equivalent Microsoft Office 365, MS SharePoint, Power Query M code, VBA, DAX Passionate about finance and technology and has the enthusiasm to continuously improve processes and flowsA mindset of creativity, innovation, and energetic drive to succeed As part of the recruitment process, successful candidates will be required to complete criminal and credit background checks Here’s what you can expect in return: A team who deeply cares about your development and long-term career at RogersA team that trusts and wants to win together A competitive salaryAccess to leading edge technology and services so we can make more possible for our customers and our business every day. A campus team that will keep you engaged through onboarding and your work termAn opportunity to learn, be creative, and work with highly technically individualsAs a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis. Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine. Schedule: [[req_RogersFullPartTime]]Shift: DayLength of Contract: 4 MonthsWork Location: 800, Gauchetiere O, Bureau 4000-Place Bonaventure - Montreal(182), Montreal, QC Travel Requirements: NonePosting Category/Function: Student/New Grad & Co-opRequisition ID: 268586 At Rogers Digital, our team doesn’t shy away from big ideas – we bring them to life. We work tirelessly to deliver the best user experiences (period) and build amazing self-serve experiences that our customers want to use. We are customer-obsessed agents of change and are committed to innovation and creating effortless experiences for customers and frontline employees. We use cutting-edge tools and technologies to solve critical and complex problems with award-winning solutions. Our work impacts millions of customers everyday. At Rogers Digital, we’re looking for people who embrace change, take risks, and push boundaries. Learn more about our team and our work @https://digital.rogers.com/

title: Junior Operations Analyst
description:
The Role

The successful candidate will have a passion for assisting others while working in a fast-paced environment, have an energetic disposition and be able to work and solve problems under minimal supervision. This is an excellent opportunity to work on many different projects for a dynamic company.

Meet Tactex

Tactex Asset Management, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Moka, makes it possible to bring high quality saving, investing and advisory services to users efficiently and at scale. Our talented team of portfolio managers and operations specialists handles investment, identity verification, and financial flows for Moka users and for other clients, and is the centre of excellence for operations globally. Tactex is a registered portfolio manager, investment fund manager and exempt market dealer, and has built a successful track record in this area. Founded in 2011, we have over $200 Million in assets under management and have conducted over $4 Billion in transactions.

Meet Moka

Moka is on a social mission to help everyone achieve their financial goals. We're already Canada’s leading saving and investing app, and we recently launched in Europe to help even more people save more, spend less and invest smarter. Since launching in 2017, the Moka app has been downloaded over 750,000 times and received thousands of 5-star reviews.

Moka makes it easy for everyone to start investing by automatically rounding up everyday purchases and investing the spare change—no minimum investment, lifestyle change or financial knowledge required. We are also building innovative new products that will help our users discover more money in their daily life by effortlessly reducing their expenses, optimizing their debt payments, accessing personalized financial insights, and earning valuable cash-back rewards.

If you want to work with talented people, solve big problems and make life better for millions of people, come join us.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Build positive relationships with clients by responding to inquiries in a timely manner, understanding the business, and maintaining professionalism
  • Translate data into easily understood reports and communicate results with team
  • Set-up of client investment policies and investment models in internal Portfolio Management System
  • Process investment funds redemption to clients’ accounts
  • Actively support the compliance and operations teams with various process enhancement projects
  • Prepare monthly reports and analyses for client accounts, including client performance reports, reports to external databases
  • Identify and promptly escalate irregular activities or issues and assist in determining corrective actions.
  • Assist in completing information requests for internal and external audits
  • Support and/or manage special projects and duties as assigned

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Ability to work in English and French
  • Highly organized and self-sufficient
  • Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities to meet internal and external deadlines
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Microsoft Excel skills
  • A willingness and ability to learn new software and technologies
  • Proven continuous process improvement mindset and positive team attitude

Why Moka/Tactex?

We are a values-driven company that is focused on making a positive impact for an entire generation. Listed in the Top 100 FinTech companies in the world by KPMG, and having recently raised our Series A from two of Canada’s largest financial institutions, we are expanding internationally with locations currently in Montreal, Paris and Amsterdam.

At Moka, we value making an impact, asking the tough questions and being inclusive. Our people and their passion are what truly set us apart. We offer:

  • Competitive executive-level compensation and stock options
  • Comprehensive benefits
  • Flexible location
  • Support for achieving career and personal development goals in a fast-growing company
  • A casual environment where you will work with smart and passionate people

We believe in being an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate diversity and differences of perspectives at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Why Fraser Health?:

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlakaâ€™pamux Nations. Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.

 

Effective October 26, 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization â€œWHOâ€ approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines).   Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.

 

Are you looking for that opportunity to put your established data expertise to use in healthcare? If you are, we want you to keep reading to discover the next stage of your career with one of BCâ€™s 2022 Top Employers.

 

Position Highlights:

We currently have an exciting opportunity for you to bring your skills and knowledge as a dedicated a  Full Time  Data Scientist  to join our Quality Improvement & Patient Safety team at our Central City offices based out of  Surrey, B.C. If you're someone who is looking for a rewarding challenge, then this might be the perfect opportunity for you.

 

In this role, you will build capacity and support for the cognitive computing learning systems improving insights gained from analyzing quality data. The Data Scientist adeptly uses data sets and machine learning (ML) models to find opportunities for product and process optimization as well as to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. While reporting to the Business Intelligence & Data Management Director, discover solutions hidden in large data sets and work with partners and functional teams to improve business processes and outcomes.

 

Key areas of involvement include:

  • Working as the lead Data Scientist and strategist for the System Optimization department, cultivating and developing a proven and sustainable machine learning foundation and competency for Fraser Health.
  • Working closely with clinical and leadership teams across the health authority to strategize and develop artificial intelligence (AI) products.
  • Identifying, cleaning, and integrating large sets of structured and unstructured datasets from disparate sources for use in ML models and products. Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is meaningful for building a ML models.
  • Using advanced ML processes to convert data from non-functional forms, such as scanned image text, to functional forms ready for use in further ML models.
  • Using advanced ML models to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities that can make predictions or reduce workload across various clinical domains within Fraser Health.
  • Implementing ML models into production by collaborating and guiding developers.
  • Identifying, engaging, and collaborating with specific partners as required for the development of AI products.
  • Communicating analytic solutions to leadership and making recommendations regarding strategic actions to maintain the ML development pipeline, analytic architectures, and life cycle to avoid potential negative consequences and system failures.

Qualifications:

  • PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field
  • Five (5) to seven (7) years of experience working with large datasets and machine learning models

Valued Benefits:

A career with Fraser Health will offer you the opportunity to be a part of a dedicated team of professionals in a dynamic and rewarding health care environment.

 

Work with an experienced and dedicated team and join our dedication to provide quality care to our patients and clients. We invite you to apply today and find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health to their friends and family as a phenomenal place to work! We value diversity in the work force and aim to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.

 

Fraser Health values diversity in the work force and strive to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.

 

Find out what itâ€™s like to work here. Like us on  Facebook(@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on  Twitter  &  Instagram(@FHCareer), or connect with us on  LinkedIn  (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights!

Detailed Overview:

Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:

The Data Scientist acts in accordance with the cognitive computing priorities of Fraser Health to build and increase capacity and support for the cognitive computing learning systems to create and enhance insights gained from analyzing quality data. The Data Scientist adeptly uses large data sets and machine learning (ML) models to find opportunities for product and process optimization as well as to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Discovers solutions hidden in large data sets and works with stakeholders and functional teams to improve business processes and outcomes.

Responsibilities:
  1. Works as the lead Data Scientist and strategist for the assigned program, to foster and develop a solid and sustainable machine learning foundation and competency for Fraser Health.
  2. Works closely with clinical and leadership teams across the health authority to strategize, develop, and implement artificial intelligence (AI) products.
  3. Identify, clean, and integrate large sets of structured and unstructured datasets from disparate sources for use in ML models and products.  Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building advanced ML models.
  4. Uses advanced ML processes to convert data from non-functional forms, such as scanned image text, to functional forms ready for use in further ML models.
  5. Uses advanced ML models to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities that can make predictions or reduce workload to make a significant impact across various clinical domains within Fraser Health
  6. Leads the process of implementation of ML models into production by collaborating and guiding developers.
  7. Identifies, engages, and collaborates with specific stakeholders as required for the development of AI products
  8. Communicates analytic solutions to leadership and informs leadership of AI product status throughout the various stages of the product lifecycle.
  9. Make recommendations to leadership regarding strategic actions to maintain the ML development pipeline, analytic architectures, and life cycle to avoid potential negative consequences and system failures increase positive impact of ML systems.
  10. Maintains detailed project status plans in order to achieve ML development cycle timelines avoiding development delays
  11. Assess and implements improvements as needed to already existing AI products and creates anomaly detection systems to track performance and data accuracy.
  12. Keeps up-to-date with latest technology trends and methods.
Qualifications:

Education and Experience

PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, 5-7 years of experience working with large datasets and machine learning models.

Skills and Abilities

Demonstrates LEADS capabilities: Leads Self; Engages Others; Achieves Results; Develops Coalitions and supports Systems Transformation.

Professional/Technical Capabilities

  • Advanced skills in AI product design and the analysis of quantitative data for the purpose of creating actionable insights and measureable impact.
  • Thorough knowledge of the principles, processes, procedures and methods involved in data mining, data analysis, statistical methods, and machine learning.
  • Demonstrated expertise in planning, organizing and coordinating AI product activities.
  • Demonstrated proficiency with using advanced machine learning methods, machine learning software packages, and manipulation of large datasets.
  • Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques including but not limited to: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, network analysis, simulation, scenario analysis, clustering analysis, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
  • Experience writing computer code, querying databases, and using statistical computer languages: Python, SLQ, R, etc.
  • Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, DigitalOcean, etc.
  • Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, AWS, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.
  • Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Jupyter, Matplotlib, D3, ggplot, Periscope, Business Objects, etc.
  • Demonstrated expertise in knowledge synthesis and translation activities.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in an interdisciplinary environment.
  • Ability to analyze complex issues and develop recommendations using facilitation and consensus building.
  • Demonstrated critical thinking and analytical skills including statistical analysis and evaluation methodology.
  • Ability to prepare and present information to multiple audiences.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Our Client in the Ontario Public Sector is looking for a Data Analytical Specialist on a 10 month contract

Must haves:

Minimum of 4-5 years must have hands on experience on PowerBL , SSIS & SQL Sever DB

Experience with scripting such as DAX & Python and R for trend analysis

Advanced experience with SQL

7-10 years experience in data analytics

Dashboards and visualizations

Advantages
Payment Every week
Long Term Contract
Hybrid Work on Site and Remote
Working in the Ontario Public Sector

Responsibilities
Lead the development and delivery of functional and ministry-specific analytics to support evidence-based decision-making and produce actionable insights

Work closely with client’s groups to assess current data analytics and reporting capabilities, gather future-state requirements and identify further opportunities for improvement

Facilitate decision-making and manage client expectations

Own the execution of analytics initiatives including end-to-end reporting and data set delivery

Develop robust statistical models and machine learning algorithms to model business scenarios and extract valid inferences

Participate in documentation, development, testing, and end user training

Work with functional area experts, Data Architects and ETL Developers and stakeholders to understand complex business issues and develop appropriate Business Intelligence solutions

Design methods to capture, structure, transform, and process data to be used to generate models

Build data models that provide information which is accurate, easy to understand and unbiased

Communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear and precise manner, providing useful visuals and summaries

Provide interpretation, advice, and expertise to client groups and other stakeholders, including direction on how to transform analytics into actionable information and proactive insights that support decision making

Qualifications
General Skills:



Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills, verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills and team work skills

Outstanding consulting and relationship management skills, with proven ability to elicit requirements, develop/consult on options and solutions, and provide effective guidance

Adept at communicating to both technical and non-technical audiences

Experience with a range of analytical methods, techniques and tools such as, but not limited to: statistical analysis and modelling, data mining, machine learning and algorithms, natural language processing, and other related disciplines at the specified experience level

Ability to manipulate and analyze complex, high-volume data from structured and unstructured sources

Experience developing data extraction, transformation, and load functionality for large relational and multi-dimensional data stores

Experience designing high quality interfaces to present information in a meaningful way to end users

Broad understanding of data management, financial and business analysis, database architecture, and information visualization

Proficiency in query languages and experience constructing complex query statements

Experience in one or more programming or scripting languages

Strong investigative and logic skills

Proficiency in mathematics and statistics

Awareness of emerging Business Intelligence trends and directions

Functional area experience as required

Experience with analytical software such as R, PowerPivot, Matlab, SPSS, or SAS an asset

Proficiency with desktop analysis software including Microsoft Excel, Access, VBA

Skills
Experience and Skill Set Requirements
Experience and Skill Set Requirements

Tools and techniques - 40%

Must have hands on experience on PowerBI , SSIS & SQL Sever DB
Experience building reports and visualizations in PowerBI
Experience with analytical methods, techniques and tools such as statistical analysis and modelling
Experience with scripting such as DAX & Python for trend analysis
BI and Analytics Experience - 40%

Experience developing BI and analytics
Experience with creating dashboards and data visualization via Power BI
Experience with cleaning, transforming and visualizing data sets
Advanced experience with SQL
Demonstrated knowledge of emerging Business Intelligence trends and directions
Experience with dimensionalized data/building cubes
Soft Skills - 15%

Outstanding consulting and relationship management skills, with proven ability to elicit requirements, develop/consult on options and solutions, and provide effective guidance
Strong verbal and written communication skills; with both technical and non-technical audiences
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision making skills
Strong leadership and collaboration skills
Proven track record for building strong working relationships
A demonstrated team player with a track record for meeting deadlines
Public Sector Experience - 5%

Demonstrated experience working within an organization of equivalent size and complexity to the Ontario Public Service.
Working knowledge and understanding of challenges and issues that ministry may have with respect to data would be an asset

Summary
Program Approval and Registration Information System (PARIS) is built to support the role of the MCU in monitoring and regulating Private Career College (PCCs) and to modernize the process through automation, business process reengineering, and improved data management. PARIS is a transformative initiative for the Private Career College (PCC) sector as it represents a major leap forward from largely paper-based processes to true digitally enabled service delivery. Re-engineered business processes and automation has greatly reduced the administrative burden on both the PCC sector and the Private Career Colleges Branch (PCCB’s) internal operations and led to improved turn-around times for key services. Ever since its implementation in 2018, PARIS is providing a client-focused user experience for its sector stakeholders through a modern user interface and the convenience of paperless application submission and online payment processing. In order to maintain the support, PARIS functionalities are continuously enhanced to implement new requirements & functional enhancements of gaps identified post GO-Live impacting services to the sector.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Senior Data scientist
description:
Senior Data scientist 
Primary Location: CA-QC-Montreal Island-Montreal  
 
Employee Status: Regular  
 
Schedule: Full-time  
  
 

Being a Senior Data Scientist at National Bank is a unique opportunity to join a team of people who are passionate about changing the banking world. We are client-focused and work on high-impact modeling projects used to manage financial crime. 

  • Are you known for your leadership? 
  • Are you forward thinking, agile, curious, creative?  
  • Are you stimulated by challenges and do you enjoy analyzing massive data to extract value?  

We are looking for an expert in data modeling and analysis who excels in multidisciplinary teamwork and who stands out for his leadership and his ability to complete high-impact mandates.


Your main challenges

  • To have a good understanding of the business needs and processes.
  • Develop an expertise in the field of money laundering risk management.
  • Work in collaboration with various stakeholders with different expertise (technology, data science, financial crime control)
  • Support and develop financial crime detection models.
  • Explore large volumes of data and test different modeling approaches in order to build effective financial crime detection models.
  • Ensure the quality and integrity of data used for modeling and visualization purposes.
  • Recommend approaches to optimize financial crime detection and reduce false positive alerts.
  • Identify, develop and document relevant variables based on business needs.
  • Design, test, document and deploy detection models.
  • Present, using effective visualizations, the results and performance of the models.
  • Contribute to financial crime reporting activities.
  • Perform ad hoc analysis and present results in a clear and concise manner.
  • Collaborate with different stakeholders and act in a solution mode.
  • Very good ability to popularize and communicate complex information.

 

 

Desired profile:

  • Completed Bachelor's degree and 6 years of relevant experience or completed Master's degree and 4 years of relevant experience (in statistics, data science, mathematics, computer science or a related field).
  • Excellent knowledge of modeling techniques such as decision trees, neural networks and regression.
  • Excellent knowledge of unsupervised approaches.
  • Advanced knowledge of SAS and SAS Miner.
  • Expertise in data visualization techniques.
  • Excellent knowledge of SQL.
  • Experience in fighting financial crime, an asset
  • Knowledge of PowerBI
  • Knowledge of R, Python, an asset.
  • Knowledge of bank data warehouses, an asset.
  • Customer experience and solution oriented attitude.
  • Be proactive, innovative and committed.
  • Strong collaboration skills.
  • Good communication and influencing skills.
  • Bilingual (spoken/written) French and English.

 

Your benefits 
Upon hiring, you will be eligible for a wide range of benefits. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer attractive benefits for you and your family:

  • Health and wellness program, including many benefits
  • Flexible group insurance
  • Defined benefit pension plan
  • Employee Share Ownership Plan
  • Employee and family assistance program
  • Preferred banking services
  • Volunteer program
  • Telemedicine
  • Virtual sleep clinic

These are just a few of the many benefits we offer. We've rolled out a number of additional measures to ensure your health, safety and wellbeing during the pandemic. 
 
We're putting people first 

We're a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people.   Our mission is to have a positive impact on peoples' lives.

Our core values of partnership, agility, and empowerment inspire us, and inclusivity is central to our commitments. We offer a barrier-free workplace that is accessible to all employees. 

We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible. If you require accommodations, feel free to let us know during your first conversations with us.

We welcome all candidates! What can you bring to our team?

Ready to live your ambitions?


 

 
Job field: Business Intelligence and Data
Job Posting: Apr 20, 2022
Unposting Date: May 9, 2022
Work Postal Code: H3B4L2 
Job Number: BUS000NL
